title: Script
content:
Looking for all type used in this logo.  
If anyone can help I'd appreciate it.  
Thanks in advance.

Font: 

 Vladimir & Brush 455 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114931/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Scan.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114931/http:/typophile.com/files/Scan_2.jpg) | 974.15 KB |
author: renuance

comments.content:
"Auto Body": **[Vladimir Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114931/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=Vladimir%20Script%20LT%20Std%20-%20Regular&fid=2158e285f7dad66acf329aeef8f0367c&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=Auto%20Body&fit=1)** by Vladimir Andrich [1995] with a modified /y

"812...": **[Brush 455](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114931/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Bitstream&ffam=Brush455%20BT%20-%20Regular&fid=22e4a3e4da3e888b3a01909f9ce618bc&fsize=60&text=812-386-1506&wrap=2)** by Martin Wilke [Bitstream, 1990]

Brush 455 was originally Palette, Martin Wilkie for Berthold 1951, later digitized by Berthold as Palette BQ [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/palette-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114931/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/palette-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/palette-bq/") I have not checked, but I expect that the Bitstrean digital was done independently without using anything digital from Berthold.  
Don

Thanks for the extra information Don.  
Yes **Palette** outlines look a bit different from **Brush 455** , in fact that's why I mentioned **Brush 455** because it looks like a better match to the given image sample.

Good call Fivos. BTW I have always appreciated the effort Bitstream put into producing well engineered fonts. Berthold seems to emphasized fidelity to the original metal versions and generally avoided "improvements" consisting of increased regularity. Slightly different objectives. Both foundries produce superior quality fonts.  
Don
Thanks all. Awesome. I appreciate the help.
